com.smartitengineering.rs.api
Interface Exporter

public interface Exporter

This API provides SPIs to use it to export objects to a stream of media type it specifies. It is the responsibility of the API client to invoke it for appropriate MediaType. API implementors should explicitly mention the media type it supports. API implementors should also ensure thread safety.

Since:
0.4
Author:
imyousuf

Method Detail

isExportSupported

boolean isExportSupported(java.lang.Class clazz,
                          java.lang.reflect.Type genericType,
                          java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] annotations)
An operation that checks whether the the object type qualified by its class is supported by this exporter. This operation should be consulted before invoking/using exportObject.

Parameters:
clazz - The class quantifying the object type
genericType - The generic applied to the object, if any
annotations - Annotations used on the class
Returns:
True if and only if export is supported else false.

getAfterExportLength

long getAfterExportLength(java.lang.Object object,
                          java.lang.Class clazz,
                          java.lang.reflect.Type genericType,
                          java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] annotations)
It provides the operation to predict the length of the exported content.

Parameters:
object - The object to export
clazz - The class of the object
genericType - The generic used with the object.
annotations - Annotations qualifying the object's class.
Returns:
-1 if length can not be predicted or else the actual length after export

exportObject

void exportObject(java.lang.Object object,
                  java.lang.Class clazz,
                  java.lang.reflect.Type genericType,
                  java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] annotations,
                  java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> headers)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Export the object quantified by clazz and genericType and qualified by the annotaitons to the outpuStream and use the headers to set meta informations regarding the object.

Parameters:
object - The object to export
clazz - The class of the object
genericType - The generic used with the object.
annotations - Annotations qualifying the object's class.
outputStream - The output stream to write and format the object to.
headers - The headers that holds the meta information
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If any error in writing to the stream, i.e. either format error or any other error.

getMediaType

javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType getMediaType()
Provides the MediaType that is supported by this exporter.

Returns:
The supported media type
